CTRL-Space to evaluate expressions from anywhere.

Lavendeux enhances the clipboard

Lavendeux inlines calculating, programming and testing utilities into your favourite text editor. Test the result of a remote API call, check the result of a regular expression and much more, all without needing to break your workflow.

Most recent version Beta Version 0.5.4

How to use it

Highlight the following block of text, and press ctrl + space

Extend Lavendeux with Python!

Extensions can be used to add functionality with Lavendeux version 0.5.0 and up!

Highlight the following block of text, and press ctrl + space

What it can do

Lavendeux supports the following mathematical operators
  • Subtraction ( - )
  • Addition ( + )
  • Subtraction ( - )
  • Multiplication ( * )
  • Division ( / )
  • Exponentiation ( ** )
  • Modulus ( % )
  • Factorial ( ! )
As well as the following binary operators
  • And ( & )
  • Or ( | )
  • Xor ( ^ )
  • Not ( ~ )
  • Left shift ( < )
  • Right shift ( > )
These mathematical functions
  • Round value up to nearest integer ceil(value)
  • Round value down to nearest integer floor(value)
  • Round value to n decimal places round(value, n)
  • Absolute value abs(value)
  • Base 10 logarithm log10(value)
  • Natural logarithm ln(value)
  • Square root sqrt(value)
  • Nth root root(value, n)
These string functions
  • Concatenation ( + )
  • String length strlen(value)
  • Substring substr(string, start, length)
  • Character code to character chr(value)
  • Character to character code ord(value)
These trigonometric functions (angles are in degrees by default!)
  • Tangent tan(value)
  • Cosine cos(value)
  • Sine sin(value)
  • Arc tangent atan(value)
  • Arc cosine acos(value)
  • Arc sine asin(value)
  • Hyperbolic tangent tanh(value)
  • Hyperbolic cosine cosh(value)
  • Hyperbolic sine sinh(value)
And the output format can be changed by added one of these decorators to the end of an expression
  • Integer @i, @int, @integer
  • Floating point @f, @float
  • Scientific notation @sci, @scientific
  • Binary @b, @bin, @binary
  • Octal @o, @oct, @octal
  • Hexidecimal @h, @hex, @hexadecimal
  • HTML color code @c, @color, @colour
Values in expressions are recognized in these formats
  • Integer 1234
  • Floating point 123.4
  • Scientific notation 1.23e+4 / 1.23e-4
  • Binary 0b111
  • Octal 0o777 / 0777
  • Hexadecimal 0xFE / #FF00FF
  • String "string" / 'string'
There are also many functions and decorators added by extensions, including many relevant to programming, and writing
More information
